title: Randha Falls
subtitle: Majestic Waterfall on the Pravara River near Bhandardara
overview: Randha Falls, located near Bhandardara in Ahmednagar district, is one of the most spectacular waterfalls in Maharashtra. The Pravara River plunges from a height of about 170 feet into a deep gorge, creating a mesmerizing view surrounded by lush greenery.
It is especially popular during the monsoon season when the waterfall roars with full force, offering a breathtaking sight for photographers and nature lovers alike.

highlights.title: Spectacular Monsoon Waterfall
highlights.description: Witness the Pravara River cascade into a deep gorge, forming a thunderous and misty waterfall.

highlights.title: Photography Paradise
highlights.description: Capture dramatic landscapes, rainbows over the waterfall, and lush monsoon greenery.

geography.intro: Randha Falls is formed by the Pravara River near Bhandardara, located in the Sahyadri mountain range of western Maharashtra.

details.label: Location
details.value: Near Bhandardara, Akole Taluka, Ahmednagar District, Maharashtra

climate.description: Randha Falls enjoys a moderate climate throughout the year, but it’s most majestic during the monsoon season when the Pravara River is at its peak.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June to September): Best time to visit; the falls are at their most powerful.
Winter (October to February): Calm weather; ideal for sightseeing and photography.

geography.conclusion: The geographical beauty of Randha Falls makes it one of the key attractions in the Bhandardara region, blending natural power and scenic elegance.

activities.title: Nature Walks
activities.description: Stroll through scenic trails around Bhandardara that offer different viewing angles of the falls.
info: Well-maintained viewpoints are available near the main fall area.
Monsoon trails become slippery — wear sturdy footwear.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Randha Falls offers incredible photo opportunities, especially with misty backdrops and rainbows.
info: Best lighting is during early morning or late afternoon.
Keep your camera gear safe from water spray.

activities.title: Spiritual and Cultural Visit
activities.description: A small temple near the falls adds a spiritual touch to the natural setting.
info: Locals visit the temple regularly during festivals.
The area offers a peaceful environment for meditation.

attractions.title: Bhandardara Dam (Wilson Dam)
attractions.description: One of the oldest dams in India, known for its scenic reservoir and boating.
attractions.value: Ideal for sunrise and sunset views.

attractions.title: Arthur Lake
attractions.description: A serene lake surrounded by mountains, perfect for picnics and boating.

attractions.title: Ratangad Fort
attractions.description: A popular trekking destination offering panoramic views of Bhandardara valley.

marineLife.intro: Being a freshwater waterfall in the Sahyadris, Randha Falls is surrounded by rich terrestrial biodiversity rather than marine life.

items.title: Wildlife
items.description: The surrounding forests are home to monkeys, deer, and various bird species.

items.title: Birds
items.description: Spot kingfishers, egrets, and parakeets near the river and waterfall.

conclusion: Randha Falls provides a soothing natural experience amidst scenic mountain beauty.
Its biodiversity and surroundings make it a perfect eco-tourism destination.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: Regular trains from Mumbai, Pune, and Nashik to Igatpuri.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Accessible via Bhandardara road from Igatpuri or Sangamner.
Private cabs and state transport buses are available.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest Airport: Nashik Airport (90 km) or Pune Airport (185 km).

gallery.alt: Misty gorge view of Randha Falls

bookingTips.description: Visit between July and September for the best waterfall flow.
Carry non-slip footwear and rain protection during monsoon.
Avoid standing near the cliff edges; the rocks are slippery and steep.
